text: How important do you think it is to donate to charities? Especially charities that help children?

I feel as if it is important to give back to society and help out charities when you can.  I think that children are an important aspect in our society as they are the future and will be the worlds next leaders.  Is there one particular one that you favor?

Have you heard of Save the Children - They do really amazing work with kids locally and globally. I like that they don't just focus on one thing, they prioritize all aspects of improving a child's life
I have not heard of them before.  Would you say they want to focus on the children and improving their lives as a whole?

Yeah definitely. They work with hunger - helping to reduce the amount of children who die from malnutrition as well as helping to support kids in war zones from violence. They do a lot of disaster relief - After the flooding in Texas last year they did a ton of work to help kids there. They also support head start organizations, and provide backpacks and back to school supplies in under served communities
Wow that is really neat, it sounds like they are on par with some of the bigger organizations.  They must have a lot of resources.  Have you been involved with them in the past?

I think they have a lot of support from donors big and small. They are one of the charities that I like to support when able. Do you feel like people who have the ability are usually pretty likely to donate to a charity like this?
I do feel like that they are as it is an admirable non profit.  If you could dontate today with the payment how much woud you donate?

I would donate the whole payment. I think sometimes we forget how much impact a microdonation can have. It seems like a small amount to us, but even that 0.30 can have an impact on someones life. What about you?

I think that a microdonation is appropriate and would agree with you that a .30 cent donation would be appropriate.  No matter how little it is, it eventually adds up and can still impact someones life.  So can it be concluded that we could agree to donate .30?
Yes, I think so. .30 can add up quickly and stretch a lot further through an organization like this than one might think

Agreed, despite how small it may be, I think they would greatly appreciate it.  I would feel comfortable making a microdonation to help them out no matter how small.  Are there any other non profits you normally are involved with?
I also really like March of Dimes and St Jude - I guess I have a soft spot for charities that help children as their primary goal
I have not had too many encounters with them, are you familiar with Mission 22, a npo for veterans?
I have not heard of that one. What does it do?

Its a non profit designed for veterans and mental health.  They work to provide mental health services for veterans suffering from PTSD and other mental health problems stemming from their time in the military.
That is really awesome! I will have to look into that one further. I don't think there is enough support in that area. Thank you for sharing that one!
It has been a great organization and its headed by many people as it has become a huge problem.  Despite that however, I think that for today we should commit .30 for the Save the Children for today.
I agree .30 is the right choice
With that being said, thank you for working with me, I greatly appreciate it and I am glad we were able to both make a micro donation.
